00001 /*
00002  *  maven Programming Language
00003  *  Created by Elliot Chance <elliot@chancemedia.com>.

00005 
00006 #include "maven.h"
00007 #include "struct_MavenCompiler.h"
00008 #include "output.h"
00009 
00010 void writeEntryPoint(MavenCompiler* c) {
00011         // this is to close the namespace
00012         writeCPPLine(c, "}\n");
00013         
00014         // the only purpose of this function to create main()
00015         // from the bits of scattered code collected along the way
00016         // as well as the global variables.
00017         writeCPPLine(c, "int main(int argc, mbyte** argv) {");
00018         
00019         // here we setup Application
00020         writeCPPLine(c, "maven::Application$static::program = new maven::String(argv[0]);");
00021         writeCPPLine(c, "maven::Application$static::arguments = new maven::objectArray((long) argc - 1);");
00022         writeCPPLine(c, "for(int argcount = 1; argcount < argc; ++argcount) maven::Application$static::arguments->a[argcount - 1] = (maven::Object*) new maven::String(argv[argcount]);");
00023         
00024         // the core bits
00025         for(int i = 0; i < c->entryPoint.length(); ++i)
00026                 c->cppFileHandle << c->entryPoint[i] << endl;
00027         
00028         // global object safety checking
00029         writeCPPLine(c, "} catch(maven::Exception* caughtGlobalException) { std::cout << caughtGlobalException->description()->s; }");
00030         
00031         writeCPPLine(c, "}\n");
00032         
00033         // now we do the post lines
00034         for(int i = 0; i < c->postLines.size(); ++i)
00035                 writeCPPLine(c, c->postLines[i]);
00036 }
